Use natural remedies: Some people swear by using natural remedies like saltwater rinses, activated charcoal, and essential oils to keep their teeth and gums healthy.
Use over-the-counter dental care products: There are many over-the-counter dental care products available, such as toothpaste, floss, and mouthwash, that can help keep your teeth and gums healthy.
Visit a dental hygienist: If you can't see a dentist, you can visit a dental hygienist who can clean your teeth and check for any oral health issues.
Eat a healthy diet: A diet rich in fruits, vegetables, and whole grains can help keep your teeth and gums healthy. Limit sugary and acidic foods and drinks that can erode tooth enamel.
Practice good overall health: Poor overall health can affect your oral health, so it's important to maintain a healthy lifestyle, including regular exercise, a balanced diet, and good sleep habits.
